title: Colgate Luminous
content:
Does anyone know what font “Luminous” is set in?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Colgate\_Lum lock-up.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080108180205/http:/typophile.com/files/Colgate_Lum%20lock-up.jpg) | 144.51 KB |

 [‹ (x) square minimal pixel font similar to Unibody - Hooge 05\_56 {Simon Duckworth, Yves}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080108180205/http:/typophile.com/node/29039 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Snoop Dogg goth font - Cloister Blackizzle, know what I'm sayin'? {BJ} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080108180205/http:/typophile.com/node/7572 "Go to next forum topic")
author: clunkipoo

comments.content: Looks very, very close to [Clarion](http://web.archive.org/web/20080108180205/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=clarion). One of the toughest parts of this sample is that the strokes on the U are of equal weight, admittedly something that could have been customized.

Clarion doesn’t match in micro-details, such as the high inner join at the top left of the M. WhatTheFont reported [Pastor Semi Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20080108180205/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/dsgnhaus/pastor/semi-bold/), which has the right U symmetry, but the serif treatment on the “S” doesn’t quite match. This could be a custom job - aside from the U symmetry, it’s a pretty generic modern cap.
